topic: Session 7 - Database storage and Relational Algebra
text: <@U530UCFTL|hrily> set the channel topic: Session 7 - Database storage and Relational Algebra
We'll wait few moments for everyone to be online

Topics for today
+ Review on Buffers
+ Database Storage
+ Relational Algebra
So let's have a quick recap

<@U55UDASSV> 
Tell us 
where should be any data brought in order to operate on it
Data should be brought from HD to RAM using Buffers

HD consists data in hundreds of GBs
and RAM is few Gigs
So we have a guy called Buffer Manager who hides this fact
He's the one responsible for bringing in the data to RAM

<@U57A20DSS> 
Can you guess some other responsibilities of Buffer Mngr
maybe it decides what data to keep temporarily in main memory based on how frequently it is used

So the few responsibilities are:
+ Get data from HD to RAM whenever required
+ Writing back the data from RAM to HD if the data has changed
<@U55UJ9MH7> tell us how does the system identify whether to write data back or not
There's something called as Dirty Bits which when set, the data is written back
But  Buffer Mngr has a little problem

The thing is 
RAM isn't unlimited
eventually it gets filled
and theres no room for new requested data
This is where the biggest responsibility of Buffer Mngr comes
It has to replace the existing data in order to bring new data
but he can't do random replacement
the replaced page may be the next request too
So we have a Buffer Replacement Policy which helps our Mngr to decide which data to replace

the popular techniques are
+ Least recently used
+ Most recently used
+ Clock replacement

Least recently used
the data which is used the oldest is replaced

But we have problem with this one
Let's say we have a table which is larger than RAM
and we access it sequentially from start to end repeatedly
this will cause call to HD on every request

So this is where Most recently Used get's handy
New pages are replaced in this case
so the total number of HD calls will be minimized in this case

okay
so next is Clock replacement 
its just an improvement over Least Recently Used

In Clock replacement 
We spare the Least Recently used once
Second time, we replace it
Is there a priority scheme set for most recently?

Nope
just replace the newest member in the RAM
None of the policy is perfect
But how does it know weather that's essential data or not
all have their advantages and disadvantages
the application decides which ones to use
what do you mean we spare it once ?
what if there isnt space and something needs to be replaced

we will go to least recently used 
if it is spared once before we will replace
else we move on to next least recently used
eventually we will find one which is spared once

What exactly do you mean by spared?
Does it mean that it has not been removed from RAM?

yes
give him one chance
next time he does mistake 
punish himadri

Okay
any more doubts in Bfr Mngr

One more thing 
We also have _Memory Management _ of Operating system 
which does the same job as Buffer Mngr

but why we need Buffer Mngr is 
Operating system deals with processes in RAM
but we are dealing with data which can be huge

got it?
if yes we'll move on to next topic]
So lets get started with database storage
we know that database stored as tuple of feild
you can think it as a row in table
each of this tuple is called a *Record*

collection of Fields = *Record*
collection of Records = *Page*
collection of Pages = *File*
But to keep it simple the System looks at database in terms of pages
So does one stored records into  a page

A file which is stored has two values to identify
+ Base address - the starting address of the file
+ Limit - lenght/size of file
also each record stored is of *fixed length*

so given base address and record index 
one can calculate location of any record
One fundamental doubt here, can we say tables or a set of records are a way to implement a schema? Not sure here
<@U530UCFTL|hrily> uploaded a file: <https://compsocnitk.slack.com/files/hrily/F5P2A237Y/pasted_image_at_2017_06_03_07_47_pm.png|Files - Base Address and Limit>

i didn't get you priyam
what do you mean by
>  a way to implement
Or in other sense can we say tables are basically schema?

scheme is description of a table 
what the table comprises of, what fields they have, what values can they store

but this is on higher level
in lower level we wont come across table
we only see pages and records
I hope your doubt is cleared

now not always the record are of fixed length
we also need to know how to store variable records

Second offers direct access to i’th field, efficient storage 
of nulls (special don’t know value); small directory overhead.
here how are the records not of fixed length ?
I dint get the second method :face_with_rolling_eyes:
this will cause records to be of uneven length

<@U55UE0J9F> 
the first 4 boxes are indices which tell where the fields are stored
so we can go directly to any feild

okay
now lets see how the variable records are stored in pages
<@U530UCFTL|hrily> uploaded a file: <https://compsocnitk.slack.com/files/hrily/F5P2W2QKZ/pasted_image_at_2017_06_03_07_59_pm.png|Storing variable records in pages>

first slot stores the pointer to free space -  in order to add new records
next slot stores number of records
consecutive slots store indices to records

now the record can be stored in any of two methods
+ Delimiter
+ Indexed

now lets see how pages are stored in a file
pages are stored using heap 
we maintain a special page 
which stores addresses of pages in that file, sequentially

okay
so have a five minute break
we'll start the next lesson

We have seen Relational Database modelling
We also have seen the SQL language to query DBs

<@U57AA2TEK> 
give me a sql query 
something which is a bit complex
google if you like
or get one from previous session

SELECT column-names
  FROM table-name1
 WHERE value IN (SELECT column-name
                   FROM table-name2 
                  WHERE condition)
So the topic we are discussing is Relational algebra

why 'algebra'
don't we  hate math enough

but relational algebra is the one which helps the System convert that  single english line of query
into series of steps to follow 
in order to get the data which we desire

There's also Relational Calculas
But we'll stick to algebra first

So any algebra is defined by two things
+ Operands
+ Operators

Selection  (  )    Selects a subset of rows from relation (horizontal).
Projection  (  )  Retains only wanted columns from relation (vertical).
Cross-product  (  )  Allows us to combine two relations.
Set-difference  ( — )  Tuples in r1, but not in r2.
Union  (  )  Tuples in r1 and/or in r2.
So let's see them one by one

I'll use following legend as we cant use math symbols:
Si - sigma, selection
Pi - Pie, projection
X - Cross Product
- - Set Difference
U - Union
<@U530UCFTL|hrily> uploaded a file: <https://compsocnitk.slack.com/files/hrily/F5N857DHQ/pasted_image_at_2017_06_03_08_26_pm.png|R1, S1 and S2(unnamed in fig)>

file.name: Pasted image at 2017_06_03 08_26 PM.png
file.title: R1, S1 and S2(unnamed in fig)

text:
Projection
select given columns
eg
Pi age (S2)
corrs sql query
select age from S2

Selection
Select rows satisfying given property

eg
Si rating>8 (S2)
corrs sql query
select * from S2 where rating>8
Union and set difference are just same as the sets

for these operations 
the two table must be *Union Compatible*
meaning
+ Same number of fields.
+ `Corresponding’ fields have the same type.
here S1 and S2 are union compatible
but union and set difference avoids duplications

okay
lets see cross product
S1 X R1: Each row of S1 paired with each row of R1.
<@U530UCFTL|hrily> uploaded a file: <https://compsocnitk.slack.com/files/hrily/F5MHYNYFJ/pasted_image_at_2017_06_03_08_33_pm.png|Eg R1 X S1>
its just as set cross product
we have values from both the tables

These were the simple operators
Lets see compound operators

Intersection
R intersection S = R   (R  S)

Sorry
R intersection S = R - (R  - S)
intersection can be expressed using basic operators

Next is Join
You have heard this in last sessin

So the Join is computed as follows:
+ Compute R X S
+ Select rows where attributes that appear in both relations have equal values
 + Project all unique atttributes and one copy of  each of the common ones.

Compare above with R1 X S1
also notice the symbol for join

now there is also a conditional join
join + condition for joining
it's symbol is theta
so why do we need this operators?

<@U56JCBFA9> can you tell
I have answered it before
It helps a system query in a systematic order
Consider R1 = Reserves and S1 = Sailors from now on

consider sql query
select sname from sailors, reserves where reserves.bid = 103 and reserves.bid = sailors.bid
how will we write it in algebra
<@U530UCFTL|hrily> uploaded a file: <https://compsocnitk.slack.com/files/hrily/F5MLYPZ7B/pasted_image_at_2017_06_03_08_46_pm.png|Two solutions> and commented: The two boxes are join symbol

initial_comment.comment: The two boxes are join symbol

text:
but see
the first solution is efficient
+ first we select bid=103 from Reserves (not from Reserves join Sailors, which is larger to search)
+ then we join it with Sailors
+ then we select sname column

okay
see why the algebra is imp
we not only need to get steps 
but we also need to get minimum number of steps
a good query optimizer will identify the efficient solution

That's it 
We are done for today
*A bonus Question*
_The first to give EFFICIENT solution will get a coffee from me from NesCafe_

give me the solution for following
Find names of sailors who’ve reserved a red boat

hurry up guys
coffee is waiting

we are developing program  to answer
we are not to answer
Select names from reserves sailors boats where sailors.sid = reserves.sid and reserves.bid=boats.bid and colour=red

I want steps guys
First this
then this
not query or equation
Select colour=Red from Boats, Join Boats with Reserves, Select sid from the result, Join Boats and Reserves with Sailors, Select sname column?
first we select color=red from boats; then we join that with reserves; we then join that with sailors; and we finally select sname from the resultant join?
(1) select boat with color red (2) Join R and S (3) Join 1&2 :see_no_evil:

others you also are invited
you did the effort

Okay
I'll leave you guys
good night
bye

any doubts 
you can pm me
